oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report of killed, wounded, and missing of the 26th Ohio Volunteer Infantry

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Chickamauga, Battle of, Ga., 1863; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Campaigns; Buell, George Pearson, 1833-1883; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Casualties
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One sheet of charts and enumerations listing the number of officers, men, and musicians from the 26th Ohio that were killed, wounded, or missing in the Battle of Chickamauga, September 19- 20, 1863. The report was prepared September 26, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 26th Ohio Volunteer Infantry, which called itself "The Groundhog Regiment," was organized in Columbus in June 1861 and served until October 1865. Directly involved in the occupation of Nashville, the unit also saw service at several major battles: Shiloh, Chickamauga, Perryville, Stones River, Franklin, and Nashville. During the war the regiment lost six officers and 116 enlisted men in battle, and 116 other enlisted men to disease.
